alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Effingham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:51AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch and Effingham. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ridgeland, Springfield, Rincon, Hardeeville, Guyton, Brooklet, Stillwell, Clyo, Ebenezer, Shawnee, Tarboro, Tillman, Pineora, Marlow, Purysburgh, Egypt, Switzerland, Stilson, Grahamville and Gillisonville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
